title: Mau - Font not found
content:
I think it's custom, but I think it might be easy to make if these are all the letters you need. The 'a' looks like a reversed G. The M looks like it could have been made by inverting the 'u' and extending the strokes, then overlaying it with the same new character. A flattened version of [TC Europa](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142737/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=205099) could be a starting point to create this. Other squared fonts might work even better.   
   
If you don't see any other letters, then I think this is a custom job for sure.
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
[Iconian's](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142737/http:/www.iconian.com/) Nolo Contendre is another possible font you could start from   
and modify. It's free and would yield this:

> ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142737im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/27186.gif)

I tried to do what I claimed could be done, and I admit I needed to play with outlines more than I thought I would have to, but here is my clumsy attempt to re-create this using Agfa's TC Europa Bold. You can see my skill with outline manipulation in Illustrator is not very polished, but this only took about 15 minutes.   
 ![Mau Europa Simulation](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142737im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/27204.gif)
